ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I feel like this course helped me become a better writer and communicator in many different ways. It has helped me think more deeply about the audiences I am appealing to and how I am justifying the relevance of what I am writing about to my readers. It has helped me to break down some of the rigid writing norms that I was exposed to in high school and really think about why Im writing in one way or another. Throughout the semester, I was also able to reflect on my writing process and time management (procrastination) and talk this through with my teacher, working towards a more healthy relationship with writing. Lastly, on the two final pieces I was able to learn a lot about a research topic that I really liked and about myself, in the personal topic I chose to write about!
Critical writing, engaging with the texts, how to understand tension and arguments in writing.
I definitely learned how to develop my own voice in writing.
I sharpened my writing skills, especially when it came to writing clearly yet succinctly.
I really learned how to write in this class. I learned how to close read and find tensions in reading.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I loved the structure and content of this course. The discussions were always very engaging and left me with a lot to think about.

Among the many strengths of this class are the intimate class environment, the manageable workload/readings, and most importantly: LIZZIE. She is one of the kindest and most attentive teachers Ive ever had and honestly shes a big part of why this class is so awesome. She designed the class herself so shes passionate about the topics and readings she brings up, but at the same time she is absolutely open to new and different perspectives. Her feedback on essays is honest and detailed but also encouraging! Some of the essay prompts did feel a bit daunting at first, due to their broadness, but once I found an angle that I liked they became awesome intellectual pursuits.

Strengths: the class chose short yet engaging works, lots of participation, and the environment felt welcoming
Weaknesses: the discussion layout sometimes felt unengaging at times
I loved the small class environment and Lizzie's insightful words during the discussions.

Everything about this course was phenomenal. The readings were very interesting, and the instructor was very considerate of students' needs and mental health throughout the semester. Very supportive class because of the instructor's kindness and leadership.
The strength of this course is that the readings were very entertaining and interesting. The topic of emotions was present throughout the class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! I loved our discussions, and the workload was perfectly manageable. With less longer readings, I was able to devote so much more time to actually understanding the material and I was really appreciative of how this was set up.

YES!!! This was my only seminar class this semester and it was honestly a beautiful experience. The more the semester went by, the closer and more comfortable I felt around my classmates and teacher, which created an awesome environment for learning. The topics we discussed were very diverse - revolving somehow the topic of human emotions - and I liked most of the readings. The essay prompts were also quite varied and I had a lot of freedom to explore my own intellectual curiosities in my writing. If you want to have a broad exposure to college writing (and reading) in a relatively low-pressure environment and you are curious about topics surrounding emotions in the human experience then this is the class for you!
I would highly recommend this course to another student because it truly helps with your writing!
Yes, for sure! Lizzie is just an amazing instructor to have.

Yes! This has been a favorite course of mine. I looked forward to each class, and always loved talking to the instructor about my writing, the readings, and tangential interests. The conversations were often very productive and thought-provoking.
I would, the course is well organized and Lizzie is an amazing professor.
